channel.title: Need help- "loading title screen -0%"
channel.description:
Hi, I am currently working on coding a 614 server just for something fun to do in my spare time. I can get the server to run fine, but when I open up the client from run.bat, the client gets stuck on "loading title screen - 0%". [URL=http://img695.imageshack.us/i/captureif.png/][IMG]http://img695.imageshack.us/img695/9981/captureif.png[/img][/URL]
I have tried changing the ip from 127.0.0.1 to localhost or my no-ip server name (for now i do not need to worry about other people playing the server, i just want to be able to play it to test things), just to see if it could be an IP connection problem, but still the same thing happens. I read on the forums somewhere that this is a cache problem, but it was never really explained how it could be fixed. I renamed the cache folders to what the source seems to be looking for (from cache614 to revengescapecache), and still, the same problem happens. Does anyone know a fix to this problem?
Additional Info: I do not have a signlink.java file, however its probably just renamed something different.

item.title: Need help- "loading title screen -0%"
item.dc:creator: @Bandos1337 Bandos1337
item.description:
@Bandos1337 wrote:

Alright, so even though id like to just get the client working locally first, i changed it all from 127.0.0.1 to localhost and still, same thing happens.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help- "loading title screen -0%"
item.dc:creator: @Wildyscape562 Wildyscape562
item.description:
@Wildyscape562 wrote:

Is there an applet_something_1 in there anywhere if so if you have not already changed to you ip address form 127.0.0.1 then do so and then try.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help- "loading title screen -0%"
item.dc:creator: @Bandos1337 Bandos1337
item.description:
@Bandos1337 wrote:

Could anyone help? Still not fixed the problem, and I noticed other people are having this probem with 614s, I have the cache in C:/, the source, the client, and the cache auto-installs if it’s not in the correct place. Does the cache possibly have the wrong files? if so, how could this be fixed?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help- "loading title screen -0%"
item.dc:creator: @x1_att_ftw_x x1 att ftw x
item.description:
@x1_att_ftw_x wrote:

haha lol i put my words wrong, if there is a folder called Cache click it, after that copy and paste your folder to where your client takes your cache from, in this case where all the caches are located /C: something liek that

Read full topic

item.title: Need help- "loading title screen -0%"
item.dc:creator: @Bandos1337 Bandos1337
item.description:
@Bandos1337 wrote:

I performed a search for signlink.java and it couldnt find any files. Is this a file for earlier revisions? Also, about half of the source’s files were just decompiled and not given names, so instead of maybe loginmanager.java or something it’s class(random number).java

Read full topic

item.title: Need help- "loading title screen -0%"
item.dc:creator: @x1_att_ftw_x x1 att ftw x
item.description:
@x1_att_ftw_x wrote:

yes it is probobly a cache problem, go
into signlink.java and find the cache, sometimes you maybe have to place the cache that you got from your Client into your cache folder

Read full topic

I have tried changing the ip from 127.0.0.1 to localhost or my no-ip server name (for now i do not need to worry about other people playing the server, i just want to be able to play it to test things), just to see if it could be an IP connection problem, but still the same thing happens.
